conclusion: Known relation linking acceleration expressed as a function of the displacement x: a(x) = v (dv/dx)
For the interval 0 ≤ x ≤ x₁ the graph shows a constant acceleration a = a₀.
Substitute a(x) = a₀ into the differential relation and integrate from the initial rest state (v = 0 at x = 0) to the point of interest (v = v₁ at x = x₁): a₀ = v (dv/dx)
When the displacement reaches x₁, the magnitude of the object’s velocity is v(x₁) = √(2 a₀ x₁).
